intro: Uleodendron ulei, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and yellowish-green foliage. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. The tree is valued for its hard, durable wood and is also used in traditional medicine.
